alert.note: Alert for Lower Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. James; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 28 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. John The Baptist, east central St. James, west central St. Tammany and southeastern Tangipahoa Parishes through 700 AM CDT... At 615 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gramercy, or near Reserve, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reserve, Laplace, Gramercy, Lutcher, Madisonville, Wallace, Edgard, North Vacherie, Garyville and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 195 and 210. Interstate 12 between mile markers 56 and 57. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Tangipahoa; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. James; St. John The Baptist
